tool.name: unifiedFIPS
tool.displayname: Create Unified Tract FIPS Field From Split FIPS Fields

param.name: inLayer
param.dialogReference: The input layer, shapefile, feature class, or editable table containing the splits FIPS fields to be transformed.

param.name: stateField
param.dialogReference: The field describing the State FIPS value for each tract.

param.name: countyField
param.dialogReference: The field describing the County FIPS value for each tract.

param.name: tractField
param.dialogReference: The field describing the Tract FIPS value for each tract.

param.name: newFieldName
param.dialogReference: The name of the new unified FIPS tool to be created.

tool.summary: Generates a new single FIPS identifier field from multiple FIPS fields
tool.usage: Many census-based geography datasets will contain FIPS identifiers that are split into multiple fields: state, county, and tract. The split nature of these fields complicates joins. In addition, oftentimes these fields are formatted as numeric fields or don't incorporate the correct number of leading zeroes, complicating reconstruction of a single FIPS identifier. This tool intelligently builds a single FIPS identifier for census tracts based on three input fields. This field is useful for performing joins, BISG workflows, and when working with other tools in this toolbox.

idCitation.resTitle: Create Unified Tract FIPS Field From Split FIPS Fields
